name: Matar Paneer
history: Matar Paneer is a popular dish in North Indian cuisine. It's a staple in many Indian households, combining the richness of paneer (cottage cheese) with the freshness of green peas.
description: Matar Paneer is a creamy and flavorful curry made with paneer cubes and green peas, simmered in a tomato-based sauce. This dish is seasoned with a blend of aromatic Indian spices, making it a delightful vegetarian option.

instructions.title: SautÃ© Onions and Spices
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add onions and ginger-garlic paste, cooking until onions turn golden.

instructions.title: Add Tomatoes and Dry Spices
instructions.description: Add pureed tomatoes, turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until the oil starts to separate.

instructions.title: Cook Peas and Paneer
instructions.description: Add green peas and a little water. Cover and cook until the peas are tender. Then add paneer cubes and cook for a few more minutes.

instructions.title: Finish with Garam Masala
instructions.description: Sprinkle garam masala over the curry and mix well.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with roti, naan, or rice.

tips: Fry the paneer cubes separately before adding to the curry for a golden texture.
Adjust the chili powder according to your spice preference.
variations: Add cream for a richer gravy.
Include other vegetables like carrots or bell peppers for added nutrition.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving bowl, garnished with a lemon wedge.
Accompany with a side of cucumber raita.
